citation.title: Seasonal and life-stage variation in the reproductive ecology of a marine apex predator, the tiger shark Galeocerdo cuvier, at a protected female-dominated site

news.title: Scientists used high tech ultrasound imaging to study tiger shark reproduction
news.summary: Home Biology Ecology February 29, 2016 February 29, 2016 Researchers from the University of Miami's Rosenstiel School of Marine and Atmospheric Science and the University of New England used the same ultrasound imaging technology used by medical…

news.title: Scientists used high tech ultrasound imaging to study tiger shark reproduction
news.summary: MIAMI - Researchers from the University of Miami's Rosenstiel School of Marine and Atmospheric Science and the University of New England used the same ultrasound imaging technology used by medical professionals on pregnant women to study the…

news.title: Scientists Use Ultrasound to Find a Shark 'Maternity Ward' in the Bahamas
news.summary: Something strange is going on with the sharks at Tiger Beach in the Bahamas. To understand it, scientists turned to new technologies that could transform the sometimes-lethal business of shark research into a less deadly pursuit.

news.title: World's 1st tiger shark ultrasound image is simultaneously horrifying and cute
news.summary: The fierce and majestic tiger shark has long had a rough go when it comes to prenatal care.

news.title: Ultrasound Imaging Reveals Bahama Sanctuary For Pregnant Tiger Sharks
news.summary: Ultrasound imaging techniques used on tiger sharks highlights a key breeding habitat in the Bahamas.
